intro: Restio leucoblepharus, commonly known as the white-eyed restio, is a perennial grass-like plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, which are often clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is typically found in coastal or inland fynbos regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
